There is one fundamental thing wrong in this lecture. It is not true that the integral of u'/u du = ln u + C. It has to be ln (abs(u)) + C. This means e.g. that the integral of sec x dx = ln (asb(sec x + tan x)) + C. The same error occurs in the final example about completing the square. The answer to that example also does not have the necessary absolute signs.
Good Job Professor
bit all over the place but that's the nature of trig
